printWidth.description: The line width limitation that Malva should *(but not must)* avoid exceeding. Malva will try its best to keep line width less than this value, but it may exceed for some cases, for example, a very very long single word.

useTabs.description: Specify use space or tab for indentation.

indentWidth.description: Size of indentation. When enabled `useTabs`, this option may be disregarded, since only one tab will be inserted when indented once.

lineBreak.description: Specify use `\n` (LF) or `\r\n` (CRLF) for line break.

hexCase.description: Control the case of hex color values.

oneOf.description: Hex color values will be kept as-is.
Hex color values will be converted to lower case.
Hex color values will be converted to upper case.

hexColorLength.description: Control the hex color values in short-hand form or long-hand form.

oneOf.description: Hex color values will be converted to short-hand form.
Hex color values will be converted to long-hand form.
Hex color values will be kept as-is.
Always use double quotes. Double quotes in strings will be escaped.
Always use single quotes. Single quotes in strings will be escaped.
Use double quotes as possible. However if there're double quotes in strings, quotes will be kept as-is.
Use single quotes as possible. However if there're single quotes in strings, quotes will be kept as-is.

operatorLinebreak.description: Control whether line break should come before or after operators.

oneOf.description: Line break will come before operators.
Line break will come after operators.

blockSelectorLinebreak.description: Control line break behavior after selector commas.

oneOf.description: Always insert line break after comma.
If the whole selector can be put on a single line, there won't be line breaks; otherwise, there will be line breaks after each comma.
Selector will be put on one line as possible. Once it exceeds `printWidth`, line break will be inserted where the code exceeds `printWidth`.

omitNumberLeadingZero.description: Control whether omit leading zero before dot of numbers or not.

trailingComma.description: Control whether trailing comma should be inserted or not.

formatComments.description: Control whether whitespace should be inserted at the beginning and end of comments.

linebreakInPseudoParens.description: Control whether line break should be inserted in pseudo class/element parens or not if current line is too long.

declarationOrder.description: Control the strategy of sorting CSS declarations (a.k.a. properties). If it's `null`, it won't sort CSS declarations.

oneOf.description: Order in a simple alphabetical manner from a - z. This strategy will also sort unknown properties.
Order from most important, flow affecting properties, to least important properties. Unknown properties won't be sorted.
Order properties applying outside the box model, moving inward to intrinsic changes. Unknown properties won't be sorted.
Don't sort CSS declarations.

singleLineBlockThreshold.description: Control the threshold value for putting block on a single line. If the number of statements in a block is less than or equal to this value, the block will be put on a single line as possible, but when the code can't fit on single line, it will still break into multiple lines.

keyframeSelectorNotation.description: Control whether to use percentage or keyword (`from` and `to`) notation as keyframe selectors.

oneOf.description: Use keyword notation. This only affects `0%` and `100%`. For other percentage values, they will be kept as-is.
Use percentage notation.
Keyframe selector notation will be kept as-is.

attrValueQuotes.description: Control whether should add quotes to attribute value in selector or not if it's not quoted.

oneOf.description: Always add quotes.
Don't add quotes to those that're not quoted. For quoted value, quotes won't be removed.

preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

selectors.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

functionArgs.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

sassContentAtRule.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

sassIncludeAtRule.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

sassMap.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

sassModuleConfig.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

sassParams.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

lessImportOptions.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

lessMixinArgs.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

lessMixinParams.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

topLevelDeclarations.preferSingleLine.description: Control whether items should be placed on single line as possible, even they're originally on multiple lines.

selectorOverrideCommentDirective.description: Text directive for overriding selector formatting.

ignoreCommentDirective.description: Text directive for ignoring formatting specific statement.
